intro: Microseris campestris, commonly known as field mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves and small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found along roadsides and in cultivated fields. Microseris campestris is an annual herb that can spread through its seeds, which are dispersed by wind and animals.
